document.heading: Eastern Market Open Air Retailing Temporary Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-133, the “Eastern Market Open Air Retailing Temporary Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-573. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 3, 1998, and April 7, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 20, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-333 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-133 became effective on July 24, 1998.

meta.search-text: ENROLLMENT(S) kwiktag 062 325 513 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 12-133 "Eastern Market Open Air Retailing Temporary Act of 1998" Pursuant to Section 4 l 2 of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P.L. 93-198 "the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 12-573, on first and second readings, March 3, 1998 and April 7, 1998, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on April 20, 1998, pursuant to Section 404(e) of "the Act and was assigned Act No. 12-333 and published in the May 15, 1998, edition of the D.C. Register (Vol. 45 page 2933) and transmitted to Congress on May 19, 1998 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(1) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 12-133, effective July 24, 1998. LINDA W. CROPP Chairman of the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: May June July 19,20,21,22 1,2,3,4,5,9,10,11,12,15,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25 14,15,16,17,20,21,22,23 ENROLLED ORIGINAL AN ACT D,C, ACT 12-333 IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA APRIL 20, 1998 Codification District of Columbia Code 1999 Supp. To permit, on a temporary basis, the interim continuation of non-food open air retailing in the exterior space at Eastern Market that is not otherwise leased. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Eastern Market Open Air Retailing Temporary Act of 1998 Sec. 2. Consistent with past practices of a Saturday Arts and Crafts Festival and Sunday Flea Market in the North Hall of Eastern Market and the adjacent public space exterior to the North Hall, as designated in the April 29, 1982, April 16, 1987, and December 27, 1995, space sub-assignments from the Commission on Arts and Humanities Sub-assignments the Department of Administrative Services may permit open air non-food retailing activities in the same manner and under the same limits and rules as these activities existed as of November 30, 1997. No open air retailing shall be permitted in the interior or exterior space that is designated in the 1966 lease between Eastern Market Corporation and the Department of Administrative Services without the agreement of the lessee, Eastern Market Corporation. Sec. 3. For purposes of this act, the premises described in the Sub-assignments include 1) The 4,500 square feet of space on the ground floor of the North end of Eastern Market; and (2) The grounds adjacent to the North end of Eastern Market (part of Lot 800 in Square 872, reference number 914.3021 which extend from the Seventh Street curb on the east to the building line, from the North Carolina curb line on the north to the building line, and from the alley curb line on the west to the building line. Sec. 4. This act shall have no fiscal impact. Note, Sections 10-138, 47-2002.1 Note, Sections 10-138, 47-2002.1 ENROLLED ORIGINAL Sec. 5 a) This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto approval by the Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Authority as provided in section 203 (a) of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995, approved April 17, 1995 (109 Stat. 116; D.C. Code § 47-392.3(a a 30-day period of Congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Code § 1-233(c)(1 and publication in the District of Columbia Register b) This act sh~ expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
